verses.verse: Now a worthless<WH1100> fellow<WH376> happened<WH7122> to be there<WH8033> whose name<WH8034> was Sheba,<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri,<WH1075> a Benjamite<WH376>;<WH3228> and he blew<WH8628> the trumpet<WH7782> and said,<WH559> "We have<WH369> no<WH369> portion<WH2506> in David,<WH1732> Nor<WH3808> do we have inheritance<WH5159> in the son<WH1121> of Jesse;<WH3448> Every<WH376> man<WH376> to his tents,<WH168> O Israel!<WH3478>"

So all<WH3605> the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> withdrew<WH5927> from following<WH310> David,<WH1732> [and] followed<WH310> Sheba<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri;<WH1075> but the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> remained<WH1692> steadfast<WH1692> to their king,<WH4428> from the Jordan<WH3383> even to Jerusalem.<WH3389>

So they were shut<WH9503> up until<WH5704> the day<WH3117> of their death,<WH4191> living<WH2424> as widows.<WH491>
Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Amasa,<WH6021> "Call<WH2199> out the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> for me within three<WH7969> days,<WH3117> and be present<WH5975> here<WH6311> yourself.<WH859>"
So Amasa<WH6021> went<WH1980> to call<WH2199> out [the men of] Judah,<WH3063> but he delayed<WH309> longer than<WH4480> the set<WH4150> time<WH4150> which<WH834> he had appointed<WH3259> him.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abishai,<WH52> "Now<WH6258> Sheba<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri<WH1075> will do<WH7489> us more<WH4480> harm<WH7489> than<WH4480> Absalom;<WH53> take<WH3947> your lord's servants<WH5650> and pursue<WH7291> him, lest<WH6435> he find<WH4672> for himself fortified<WH1219> cities<WH5892> and escape<WH5337> from our sight.<WH5869>"

So Joab's men<WH376> went<WH3318> out after<WH310> him, along with the Cherethites<WH3774> and the Pelethites<WH6432> and all<WH3605> the mighty<WH1368> men;<WH1368> and they went<WH3318> out from Jerusalem<WH3389> to pursue<WH7291> Sheba<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri.<WH1075>

When they were at the large<WH1419> stone<WH68> which<WH834> is in Gibeon,<WH1391> Amasa<WH6021> came<WH935> to meet<WH6440> them. Now Joab<WH3097> was dressed<WH2296> <WH3830> in his military attire,<WH3830> <WH4055> and over<WH5921> it was a belt<WH2290> with a sword<WH2719> in its sheath<WH8593> fastened<WH6775> at his waist;<WH4975> and as he went<WH3318> forward,<WH3318> it fell<WH5307> out.

And Joab<WH3097> said<WH559> to Amasa,<WH6021> "Is it well<WH7965> with you, my brother<WH251>?" And Joab<WH3097> took<WH270> Amasa<WH6021> by the beard<WH2206> with his right<WH3225> hand<WH3027> to kiss<WH5401> him.

But Amasa<WH6021> was not on guard<WH8104> against the sword<WH2719> which<WH834> was in Joab<WH3097>'s hand<WH3027> so he struck<WH5221> him in the belly<WH2570> with it and poured<WH8210> out his inward<WH4578> parts<WH4578> on the ground,<WH776> and did not [strike] him again;<WH8138> and he died.<WH4191> Then Joab and Abishai<WH52> his brother<WH251> pursued<WH7291> Sheba<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri.<WH1075>

Now there stood<WH5975> by him one<WH376> of Joab<WH3097>'s young<WH5288> men,<WH5288> and said,<WH559> "Whoever<WH4310> <WH834> favors<WH2654> Joab<WH3097> and whoever<WH4310> <WH834> is for David,<WH1732> [let him] follow<WH310> Joab."

But Amasa<WH6021> lay<WH1556> wallowing<WH1556> in [his] blood<WH1818> in the middle<WH8432> of the highway.<WH4546> And when the man<WH376> saw<WH7200> that all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> stood<WH5975> still,<WH5975> he removed<WH5437> Amasa<WH6021> from the highway<WH4546> into the field<WH7704> and threw<WH7993> a garment<WH899> over<WH5921> him when<WH9201> he saw<WH7200> that everyone<WH3605> who came<WH935> by him stood<WH5975> still.<WH5975>

As soon<WH9201> as he was removed<WH3014> from the highway,<WH4546> all<WH3605> the men<WH376> passed<WH5674> on after<WH310> Joab<WH3097> to pursue<WH7291> Sheba<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri.<WH1075>

Now he went<WH5674> through<WH5674> all<WH3605> the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> to Abel<WH59> even to Beth-maacah and all<WH3605> the Berites;<WH1276> and they were gathered<WH6950> together and also<WH637> went<WH935> after<WH310> him.

And they came<WH935> and besieged<WH6696> <WH5921> him in Abel<WH62> Beth-maacah, and they cast<WH8210> up a mound<WH5550> against<WH413> the city,<WH5892> and it stood<WH5975> by the rampart;<WH2426> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> who<WH834> were with Joab<WH3097> were wreaking<WH7843> destruction<WH7843> in order to topple<WH5307> the wall.<WH2346>

Then a wise<WH2450> woman<WH802> called<WH7121> from the city,<WH5892> "Hear,<WH8085> hear!<WH8085> Please<WH4994> tell<WH559> Joab,<WH3097> 'Come<WH7126> here<WH5704> <WH2008> that I may speak<WH1696> with you.'"

So he approached<WH7126> her, and the woman<WH802> said,<WH559> "Are you Joab<WH3097>?" And he answered,<WH559> "I am." Then she said<WH559> to him, "Listen<WH8085> to the words<WH1697> of your maidservant.<WH519>" And he answered,<WH559> "I am listening.<WH8085>"
Then she spoke,<WH559> saying,<WH559> "Formerly<WH7223> they used to say,<WH559> 'They will surely<WH7592> ask<WH7592> [advice] at Abel,<WH59>' and thus<WH3651> they ended<WH8552> [the dispute.]

"I am of those who are peaceable<WH7999> [and] faithful<WH539> in Israel.<WH3478> You are seeking<WH1245> to destroy<WH4191> a city,<WH5892> even a mother<WH517> in Israel.<WH3478> Why<WH4100> would you swallow<WH1104> up the inheritance<WH5159> of the Lord<WH3068>?"
And Joab<WH3097> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> "Far<WH2486> be it, far<WH2486> be it from me that I should swallow<WH1104> up or destroy!<WH7843>

"Such<WH3651> is not the case.<WH1697> But a man<WH376> from the hill<WH2022> country<WH2022> of Ephraim,<WH669> Sheba<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri<WH1075> by name,<WH8034> has lifted<WH5375> up his hand<WH3027> against King<WH4428> David.<WH1732> Only<WH905> hand<WH5414> him over,<WH5414> and I will depart<WH1980> from the city.<WH5892>" And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> to Joab,<WH3097> "Behold,<WH2009> his head<WH7218> will be thrown<WH7993> to you over<WH1157> the wall.<WH2346>"

Then the woman<WH802> wisely<WH2451> came<WH935> to all<WH3605> the people.<WH5971> And they cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> the head<WH7218> of Sheba<WH7652> the son<WH1121> of Bichri<WH1075> and threw<WH7993> it to Joab.<WH3097> So he blew<WH8628> the trumpet,<WH7782> and they were dispersed<WH6327> from the city,<WH5892> each<WH376> to his tent.<WH168> Joab<WH3097> also returned<WH7725> to the king<WH4428> at Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Now Joab<WH3097> was over<WH413> the whole<WH3605> army<WH6635> of Israel,<WH3478> and Benaiah<WH1141> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiada<WH3077> was over<WH5921> the Cherethites<WH3774> and the Pelethites;<WH6432>
